text:
Message 302 of 4024
Sure... we can keep it quick and light weight.
Meditation date update
Stuff  planned to move today
Your stuff , kids stuff, bikes
State of Apartment and email
Sent:01/08/2024 at 12:21 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/08/2024 at 12:27 PM)
Subject:Re: Touch Base
Message 303 of 4024
Hey-
Not fighting and it’s your choice but I was unaware that you are not reachable for either of those scenarios. fwiw- I don’t agree with your unilateral
decision to disable all hi-pri urgent communications about our children and it is inconsistent with Dr Brown’s guidance. Don’t want a fight however.
Thanks
Sent:01/08/2024 at 12:48 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/08/2024 at 12:51 PM)
Subject:Urgent and Emergency Contact
Message 304 of 4024
I did inform you the other day as texts and calls were used for non emergency situations and inappropriate content that made me feel threatened,
unsafe, triggered and incredibly anxious. They crossed the line.
I can ask my lawyer on options, as can you and open to feedback but I cannot subject myself to these types of communications.
One option is that our text messages always include a third party and never direct to each other.
Sent:01/08/2024 at 12:57 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 01/08/2024 at 12:57 PM)
Subject:Re: Urgent and Emergency Contact
Message 305 of 4024
Here are the only things I have texted you. Both were quick twitch enough to send by text. I wondered why you lit into me at Basketball and did not
seem to know about my offer for child logistics, but it makes sense now. I hope we can get back to the phase I parenting plan soon. And I
acknowledge that means I need to be judicial in my use as well. I have not shown you the consistency nor the discipline you deserve. Please let me
know what your plans are so I’m not surprised again.
Sent:01/08/2024 at 12:57 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/08/2024 at 12:57 PM)
Subject:Re: Urgent and Emergency Contact
Attachments:IMG_0843.PNG (1 MB)
